title: LME aluminium holds steady at USD 2,854/t and alumina platts stays flat at USD 313.5/t
summary: On December 4, 2025, the London Metal Exchange (LME) aluminium price remained steady at USD 2,854 per tonne with no change from the previous day’s close. The 3-month bid and offer prices rose slightly, while inventory levels showed a decline in opening stock and cancelled warrants but stable live warrants.

title: In December, Aluminum Prices Rose, Driving Up Aluminum Scrap Prices
summary: Aluminum futures opened higher and fluctuated near 21,100 yuan/mt, with increased market participation. Primary aluminum spot prices rose significantly, pushing aluminum scrap prices up as well. Tight supply, environmental crackdowns, and transportation restrictions are contributing to cautious market sentiment and expected price volatility.

title: Aluminum Prices Soar
summary: Aluminum prices reached their highest levels in three years, trading around USD 2,880–2,920 per ton, driven by production constraints in China and supply limits. The recent rally suggests a structural supply deficit beginning to materialize, with forecasts indicating potential further upside if prices hold above USD 2,800.

title: Aluminum Hits 4-week Low
summary: Aluminum prices decreased to USD 2,784 per tonne, the lowest since October 2025, but have gained 1.52% over the past four weeks and 7.8% over the last 12 months. Prices have shown some volatility but remain elevated compared to previous years.

title: Aluminum Prices Hit 3-Year High: Is It the Next Key Metal in the Clean Energy Shift?
summary: Aluminum prices surged to a three-year high near USD 2,800 per tonne, driven by rising demand from electric vehicles, solar, and grid upgrades. Supply concerns include China's production caps, environmental regulations, and geopolitical risks affecting bauxite imports from Guinea.

title: SMM Weekly Survey: Aluminum Processing Industry Strained by Off-Season and High Aluminum Prices with Structural Divergence Persisting
summary: The operating rate of domestic aluminum downstream processing enterprises fell slightly due to high aluminum prices suppressing spot order transactions. Primary aluminum alloy production remained stable, but demand was cautious with structural divergence across sectors. Export orders show promise, but domestic operations remain constrained by price fluctuations and weak year-end stockpiling.

title: Metalysis Begins Commercial Production of High Scandium Loading Aluminium Scandium Alloy Powder
summary: Metalysis has started commercial production of high-purity aluminium scandium alloy powder, addressing critical needs in semiconductor, aerospace, and defense sectors. The company is scaling production from Gen 2 units to larger Gen 3 and Gen 4 units to meet growing market demand, driven by Western supply chain diversification away from China.

title: LME Aluminium Holds Steady at USD 2,854/t and Alumina Platts Stays Flat at USD 313.5/t
summary: LME aluminium prices remained steady at around USD 2,854 per tonne on December 4, with minor fluctuations in 3-month bids and offers. Alumina prices also stayed flat at USD 313.5 per tonne. Inventory levels saw slight decreases, indicating stable market conditions.

title: Tracking the Impact of U.S. Tariffs on Five Targeted Canadian Industries
summary: Despite 25% U.S. tariffs on Canadian aluminum imports, Canadian aluminum production only declined modestly by 2% through September 2025, with employment in aluminum manufacturing increasing by 5%. High global demand and prices have helped offset production drops, while the U.S. has limited capacity to replace Canadian aluminum imports.

title: NioCorp Acquires Scandium Alloy Assets to Support Potential First Ever Vertically Integrated U.S. Scandium Mine-to-Markets Supply Chain
summary: NioCorp completed the acquisition of FEA Materials' assets and IP to produce aluminum-scandium master alloy in the U.S., aiming to establish a vertically integrated scandium supply chain. This move supports growing market demand in defense and commercial sectors and complements NioCorp's Elk Creek Project for critical minerals.

title: China's Total Aluminum Production Flat WoW but Up 3% YoY
summary: China's aluminum production from November 27 to December 3 was 856,000 metric tons, unchanged week-over-week but increased 3% year-over-year. This reflects steady output amid market conditions, according to Citi research.

title: ALUPCO pioneers sustainable aluminium for the energy transition era
summary: ALUPCO is advancing sustainable aluminium production through technological upgrades like automation and Industry 4.0 tools, strategic partnerships, and recycling programs producing 'green billets'. The company focuses on energy-efficient processes, water recycling, and low-VOC chemicals, aligning with circular economy principles and LEED standards. An upcoming IPO aims to fund expansion in solar-frame and low-carbon extrusion lines, positioning ALUPCO as a global leader in low-carbon aluminium solutions.

title: Aluminum's Impact on Sustainable Development Goals
summary: This article highlights aluminum's role in sustainable development through recycling innovation, energy efficiency, and economic growth. It emphasizes aluminum's recyclability enabling closed-loop manufacturing and the use of AI to improve recycling efficiency and quality control. Market projections indicate strong growth driven by automotive electrification and construction, with investment opportunities in recycling infrastructure, renewable energy integration, and supply chain optimization.

title: Aluminum Recycling Market to Reach US$91.3 Billion by 2032 as Global Demand for Low-Carbon Metals & Circular Manufacturing Surges
summary: The aluminum recycling industry is expanding rapidly due to technological innovation, policy support, and market demand for low-carbon metals. Recycling aluminum uses 95% less energy than primary production, driving investments in advanced sorting and smelting technologies. The industry is moving towards hydrogen-powered remelting and AI-guided scrap sorting, with OEM mandates increasing recycled aluminum content in electric vehicles to 60-70%.

title: Decarbonizing Aluminum - RMI
summary: RMI collaborates with aluminum producers, buyers, and financiers to decarbonize the aluminum sector, which accounts for about 2-3% of global greenhouse gas emissions. The initiative includes carbon accounting at the product level, promoting low-emission technologies like smelting, and a finance framework called Sustainable Aluminum Principles to support investments aligned with a 1.5°C climate pathway. Increasing post-consumer recycling and emissions transparency are key strategies.

title: RUSAL Goes Greener: Innovative Aluminium Can made from 75% Recycled Aluminium and ALLOW INERTA to Appear Soon
summary: RUSAL announced the development of an innovative aluminum can made from 75% recycled aluminum, enhancing sustainability in packaging. This innovation supports circular economy principles by significantly increasing recycled content in aluminum products, reducing environmental impact and resource consumption.

title: [SMM Analysis] Analysis of Steel Price Trends in December
summary: Steel prices have shown a volatile trend recently with slight declines in hot metal production but high levels overall. Inventory is expected to continue declining in December, though destocking for sheets and plates remains slow. Macro expectations around domestic policy meetings may provide limited upside for steel prices, but persistent destocking pressure and weak sales could constrain price increases.

title: Steel prices hit five-year low; weak trend likely to persist in near term
summary: Domestic steel prices have fallen to a five-year low due to weak export demand, rising imports, and global oversupply. Despite the drop in finished steel prices, raw material costs like iron ore and coking coal remain relatively stable, pressuring mill margins. Steel prices are expected to stay subdued in the near term because of high inventories, sluggish demand, and seasonal weakness, with potential production cuts if prices fall further.

title: HRC Steel Hits 15-week High
summary: Hot-Rolled Coil (HRC) steel prices rose to $906 per ton, marking a 15-week high and a 6.84% increase over the past month. The price is also up 32.07% compared to the same period last year, reflecting a positive trend in the benchmark steel market despite recent volatility.

title: American steel producers are gradually raising prices for rolled products
summary: In the US market, steel producers are gradually increasing prices for Hot-Rolled Coil (HRC) products, with current market prices ranging from $825 to $865 per short ton. Delivery times for spot orders remain within 3-5 weeks, indicating steady demand and supply conditions.

title: U.S. Steel to restart second blast furnace in Granite City
summary: U.S. Steel announced it will restart its second blast furnace at Granite City Works, aiming to hire 400 new workers. This move reverses previous idling decisions and is seen as a positive development for the facility amid ongoing ownership changes and investment plans excluding Granite City.

title: Steelmaking decarbonisation
summary: BHP highlights the ongoing challenge of decarbonising steel production as demand rises globally. The company supports multiple technology pathways, including carbon capture and renewable energy, to achieve near zero emissions steel production, despite project delays due to high costs.

title: World's First General Design Approval (GDA) for Developed Steel and Post-Weld Heat Treatment (PWHT) Exemption based on ECA for Low-pressure LCO2 Tanks
summary: Mitsubishi Shipbuilding and Nippon Steel received the world's first General Design Approval for a new high-strength steel that allows exemption from post-weld heat treatment in large low-pressure LCO2 tanks. This innovation is expected to reduce costs and improve productivity in steel manufacturing for CO2 transport.

title: The President of the Treasury Board will highlight measures to protect and transform Canada's steel and lumber industries
summary: The Canadian government announced upcoming measures to support and transform the steel and lumber industries, with an event scheduled at Brannon Steel to highlight these initiatives aimed at protecting the sector.

title: U.S. Steel fined for leaking oil into Monongahela River
summary: U.S. Steel was fined $135,000 and required to implement stronger pollution controls after environmental regulators found the company leaked oil into the Monongahela River at its West Mifflin facility.

title: AI Startup Leads UK Steel Towards Net Zero
summary: Deep.Meta, a UK manufacturing startup, demonstrated it can reduce steel production emissions by nearly 10% at Spartan UK's steel plant, advancing efforts toward net zero emissions in the steel industry.

title: Hydrogen-Based Ironmaking Technology: Green Steel Guide
summary: Hydrogen-based ironmaking technology offers a revolutionary method to cut steel production emissions by 95% through clean chemical reduction processes. This innovation could transform global steel production by enabling decarbonisation, supported by renewable energy, advanced electrolyser technologies, AI-driven process control, and material science advances.

title: AI Startup Deep.Meta Pushes UK Steel Toward Lower Emissions
summary: Deep.Meta's AI-driven simulations have achieved nearly a 10% emissions reduction at Spartan UK, the country's only steel plate producer. The company is advancing its Deep.Optimiser PhyX system with government support, aiming to optimize steel production processes, reduce energy use, and support net zero goals across global steel markets.

title: Steelmaking decarbonisation - BHP
summary: BHP is supporting multiple technology pathways to reduce greenhouse gas emissions in steelmaking, including carbon capture and renewable energy integration. The company aims to help the industry achieve a 30% reduction in emissions intensity relative to conventional blast furnace steelmaking, with widespread adoption expected after 2030.

title: World's First General Design Approval (GDA) for Developed Steel and Post-Weld Heat Treatment (PWHT) Exemption based on ECA for Low-pressure LCO2 Tanks
summary: Mitsubishi Shipbuilding and Nippon Steel have achieved the world's first General Design Approval for a new steel and manufacturing process exempting post-weld heat treatment for large low-pressure liquid CO2 tanks. This breakthrough enhances economic viability and productivity while supporting carbon neutrality goals through advanced steel solutions.

title: Copper Price Surge Drives 34% Rally Amid Supply Constraints
summary: Copper prices have surged 34% year-to-date in 2025, reaching US$5.33 per pound, a four-month high driven by supply constraints, energy transition demand, and disruptions in Chile and Chinese smelters. The rally accelerated in the final quarter with a 13% gain since late August and a 5% jump in the first week of December, with forecasts suggesting prices could reach $16,000 per tonne under favorable conditions.

title: Copper Hits All-Time Highs! Scrap Prices Surge Heading Into December 2025
summary: Copper futures have broken all-time price records due to speculative buying and algorithm-driven trades, despite weak mill demand in major markets. The rapid price increase of about 5% in days is driven primarily by investor flows and thin inventories, raising volatility concerns for scrappers and recyclers.

title: Copper prices hit new record high
summary: Copper prices reached a new record high of $11,294.50 per ton in London’s futures market, driven by supply chain challenges and uncertainty over US tariffs. Demand continues to grow with significant shipments to the US as traders await clarity on import duties.

title: Copper price won't stay above $11,000 for long, says Goldman
summary: Goldman Sachs cautions that copper’s recent rally above $11,000 per ton is unlikely to be sustained as current fundamentals show adequate supply despite market optimism. They highlight that the rally is driven by expectations of future tightness rather than present demand, with a global surplus expected until at least 2029 and potential demand slump in China.

title: Copper hits record high after Citi lifts price outlook
summary: Copper reached a record high following Citi's upgraded price outlook, fueled by supply concerns and optimistic market sentiment. The rally reflects ongoing worries about supply disruptions amid strong demand expectations.

title: Copper Prices Surge Amid Bullish Outlook and Supply Concerns
summary: Copper prices surged 1.2% to $11,581.50 per ton, surpassing earlier highs this week. Analysts from Citigroup predict continued strength driven by supply concerns and a bullish market outlook.

title: The Alumbrera mine is expected to commence production in 2028
summary: The Alumbrera mine is slated to start production in 2028. Kamoa-Kakula set copper production targets of 380,000 to 420,000 mt for 2026 and 500,000 to 540,000 mt for 2027, maintaining a medium-term target of 550,000 mt. The Kamoa-Kakula copper smelter began operations on December 1, 2025, with copper sales in 2026 expected to exceed production due to inventory reductions.

title: Glencore eyes $2.4b copper push
summary: Glencore announced plans to increase copper output to about 1 million tonnes by 2029 and 1.6 million tonnes by 2035, up from 850,000–875,000 tonnes in 2025. The company plans a $2.4 billion capital investment for a project expected to yield 880,000 tonnes of copper over 21 years, with a final investment decision expected in the first half of 2027. This expansion is driven by rising copper prices and demand from electric vehicles and data centers.

title: Copper price won't stay above $11,000 for long, says Goldman
summary: Goldman Sachs analysts predict that despite recent supply disruptions tightening copper availability, global demand growth has softened, and they do not foresee a global copper shortage until at least 2029. Copper prices recently hit a record high due to supply concerns and US-bound shipments ahead of potential tariffs, but demand weakness, especially in China, may limit price sustainability.

title: BHP becomes global copper barometer
summary: BHP shares rose over 3% amid signs of a tentative rebound in Chinese copper demand, with Chinese producers increasing operating rates in November. Despite high copper prices causing some substitution with aluminum, BHP remains a key indicator of global copper activity, producing over two million tonnes in FY25 and contributing nearly 45% of group EBITDA. The company’s valuation is closely tied to Chinese market movements and copper demand.

title: Adani, Hindalco seek Peru copper assets as demand surges
summary: India's copper imports rose 4% to 1.2 million metric tons in the fiscal year ending March 2025, with demand expected to climb to 3-3.3 million tons. In response, Indian companies Adani and Hindalco are seeking copper assets in Peru to secure supply amid surging demand.

title: Rio Tinto's Nuton Technology: A Game-Changer in Low-Carbon Copper Production
summary: Rio Tinto's Nuton bioleaching technology significantly reduces carbon emissions and water use by 60-80% compared to traditional copper production methods. It produces 99.99% pure copper at mine sites with a carbon footprint far below global averages, supporting the growing demand for sustainable copper in renewable energy and electric vehicles.

title: Gunnison Copper Announces That Rio Tinto's Nuton Technology Produces First Copper
summary: After over 30 years of R&D, Rio Tinto's Nuton bioleaching technology produced its first copper cathode at Gunnison Copper's Johnson Camp mine. The technology achieves up to 80% less water usage and 60% lower carbon emissions than conventional methods, aiming to produce copper with the lowest carbon footprint in the U.S.

title: Rio Tinto's Nuton tech makes first-ever copper cathode at Gunnison mine
summary: Nuton's proprietary bioleaching technology produced the first copper cathode at Gunnison Copper's Johnson Camp mine, demonstrating cleaner, faster, and more efficient copper production at industrial scale. The technology reduces water use by up to 80% and carbon emissions by up to 60%, while shortening supply chains by producing copper cathode directly at the mine.

title: Vale–Glencore Sudbury Venture Aims to Unlock 880,000-Ton Copper Volume for North America
summary: Vale and Glencore plan to deepen and extend an existing mine shaft in Canada's Sudbury Basin to unlock about 880,000 metric tons of copper over 21 years. This brownfield approach reduces environmental impacts and capital expenses, supporting North America's critical minerals supply for clean energy technologies and the global low-carbon transition.

title: High cash flow enables dividend uplift: Aurubis confirms sustainable growth strategy
summary: Aurubis started production of phase one of its Richmond project in the US, the first secondary smelter for complex multimetal recycling in North America. The plant will process around 180,000 tons of complex recycling materials annually once phase two is completed, contributing to sustainable copper supply and reducing reliance on imports in the US market.

title: Nickel price hits 4-year low as gloom offsets potential Indonesia cuts
summary: Nickel prices fell to their lowest level since November 2020, dropping as much as 2.3% on the London Metal Exchange due to a pessimistic outlook from the Federal Reserve and expectations of fewer interest-rate cuts in 2025. Despite Indonesia considering deep cuts to nickel mining quotas to support prices, the metal has declined about 8% this year amid new supply and slowing electric-vehicle sales.

title: On December 5, the SMM #1 refined nickel price was ...
summary: The SMM #1 refined nickel price ranged between 117,400 and 122,700 yuan per metric ton on December 5, with an average price of 120,050 yuan/mt, marking a decrease of 350 yuan/mt from the previous day.

title: LME nickel price rebounds above $14,900 on weak US dollar expectations
summary: Nickel futures on the London Metal Exchange rebounded above $14,900 per ton on December 1, reaching a one-week high, driven by expectations of a weaker US dollar.

title: [SMM Nickel Flash] SMM December 5: Domestic high-grade NPI ex-factory price observed
summary: According to SMM, the domestic high-grade nickel pig iron (NPI) ex-factory price was recently observed at 910-920 yuan per nickel unit on December 5, reflecting current market conditions.

title: First Atlantic Nickel Expands Phase 2X Drilling at Pipestone XL Nickel Alloy Project
summary: First Atlantic Nickel is expanding its Phase 2X drilling program at the Pipestone XL project, targeting a 1.4-kilometer strike length and 850-meter width at the RPM zone. The project aims to provide a secure, low-energy, and environmentally sustainable nickel supply chain for North America by bypassing traditional smelting and roasting processes. Updates on recovery and concentrate products for nickel, chromium, and cobalt are expected in early 2026.

title: US Minerals Projects Seek 'Industrial Vision' from Washington to Compete with China
summary: Executives from US minerals companies are urging the government to develop a comprehensive industrial plan to build a critical minerals supply chain including nickel. They advocate for pressuring Indonesia to limit nickel production, which currently accounts for about 60% of global supply and has depressed prices. The goal is to support domestic nickel refining capacity, such as Westwin Elements' planned refinery in Oklahoma, and stabilize nickel prices.

title: USGS Director Champions Domestic Mining
summary: The US Geological Survey director emphasized the importance of domestic mining to meet the growing demand for critical minerals including nickel. Expanding mining capacity is essential to support the generation and transmission infrastructure needed for energy and technology sectors.

title: Vale Foresees Higher Iron Ore, Copper & Nickel Production Next Year
summary: Vale projects a 10% increase in nickel production for the upcoming year, alongside modest increases in iron ore and copper output. This forecast reflects the company's plans to expand its mining operations and meet growing demand for nickel in various industries.

title: The Art of the Critical Minerals Deal: The United States and Australia Framework to Secure Reliable Rare Earths Supplies
summary: The United States and Australia have agreed to accelerate the secure supply of critical minerals including nickel through joint financing and project development. The framework includes at least US $1 billion in near-term financing to support projects delivering critical minerals for defense, advanced manufacturing, and energy transition technologies.

title: TECH Project high-grade nickel is primed to fuel the global green transition
summary: Queensland Pacific Metals’ TECH Project aims to become the world’s premier source of high-grade, ethically derived nickel to support the green transition. The project uses an environmentally-friendly DNi Process with over 98% nitric acid recycling and no tailings dam requirements, promising a carbon-negative, sustainable nickel production for EV batteries and energy storage industries.

title: Outlook for the Nickel Industry in the 15th Five-Year Plan Period
summary: The global nickel market currently faces structural oversupply, with a shift in industry focus from scale expansion to high-quality development emphasizing technology, cost efficiency, and sustainability. The plan highlights green manufacturing, vertical integration, and industrial cluster development as key to enhancing competitiveness and reducing carbon emissions in nickel production.

title: Nickel Industry News, Views and Commentary - Chronickels
summary: NOVONIX’s patented all-dry, zero-waste cathode synthesis technology is expected to reduce costs and environmental impact in nickel-based cathode production. The article discusses nickel’s sustainability potential across its value chain, emphasizing the importance of responsible mining, manufacturing, and recycling to support the expanding electric vehicle battery market.

title: China Built Indonesia's Nickel Boom: Market Analysis
summary: China controls about 75% of Indonesia’s nickel operations, crucial for EV battery supply chains. The article highlights shifts in battery chemistry preferences, supply chain diversification away from China, and the growing importance of sustainable nickel production methods as key factors shaping the global nickel market and energy transition.

title: Carrascal Nickel Corporation Strengthens Its Position as a Responsible Mining Leader in APAC Through Sustainability and Community-Focused Initiatives
summary: Carrascal Nickel Corporation, a Philippine mining company, emphasizes responsible mining, environmental sustainability, and community partnership in its nickel and iron ore operations. The company is reinforcing its commitment to sustainable practices in the Asia-Pacific region.

title: Climate-friendly metals can come from deep-sea ores
summary: A new process using hydrogen reduction to extract nickel, cobalt, and copper from deep-sea ores significantly reduces CO2 emissions by over 90% compared to carbon-based methods. This innovative approach requires less energy and fewer steps, offering a more sustainable alternative for sourcing critical metals needed for batteries and clean technologies.

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali: 94% of the energy used comes from renewable sources and 93% of employees have permanent contracts
summary: On World Environment Day 2025, Cogne Acciai Speciali released its first Group Sustainability Report highlighting that over 94% of the electricity used by the Group comes from certified renewable sources. summary: Italian steel pipe manufacturer Tenaris posted a 7% decline in net sales for the second quarter of 2025, mainly due to lower deliveries in Europe and Brazil. The report highlights challenges in the European market impacting the company's performance.

title: Tenaris Acquires isOplus Oil and Gas Division in $10M Deal, Expands Pipe Coating Business
summary: Tenaris completed a $10 million acquisition of isOplus's oil and gas division, gaining ownership of pre-insulated pipeline systems used for district heating and anti-corrosion applications. This strategic move expands Tenaris's pipe coating business in the energy sector.

title: Edison Energia, Prysmian in 150MW Italy Solar PV PPA
summary: Prysmian signed a multi-year corporate power purchase agreement (PPA) with Edison Energia to purchase power from a 150MWp solar PV plant in Viterbo, Italy. This deal will supply about 25% of Prysmian's annual electricity consumption in Italy, supporting its sustainability goals and stable energy costs amid Italy's growing utility-scale solar market.

title: Northern Sun Energy and PowerFlex Announce Solar + Storage Behind-the-Meter Project for Prysmian Manufacturing
summary: Northern Sun Energy and PowerFlex are developing a 7.5 MWp solar array with 1MW battery storage to power Prysmian's cable manufacturing plant in Du Quoin, Illinois. The facility produces copper medium voltage cables used in renewable energy, and the project will generate 50% of the plant's energy needs, reducing grid reliance and enhancing sustainability.

title: Prysmian Group speeds up innovation with the support of EIB and undertakes new projects in the areas of ultra-rapid telecom networks and smarter, more sustainable power grids
summary: Prysmian Group secured €135 million financing from the EIB to support innovation in submarine and land power transmission cables, dynamic cables for offshore renewables, e-mobility cable solutions, and smart cable systems for power grids. This investment aligns with Prysmian's strategy to promote digitalization and energy transition in Italy and Europe.
